form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service, Form 9-132-St.Paul-A

full_text: Form 19-132-StePaul-A 11-10-48 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE Immigration and Naturalization Service 1014 New Post Office Building Saint Paul 1, Minnesota July 11, 1951 File No. A6 699 884 Mr. Maoling Liu 630 Lincoln Street N. E. Minneapolis, Minnesota Dear Sir: The records of this Service show that the time for which you were admitted to the United States temporarily as a non-quota student will expire If you intend to continue your studies 1951 period, the enclosed application for extension of stay (Form I-535) should be completed in every detail and returned to this office. Your passport or other travel document valid at least 60 days beyond the date to which you soek an extension must accompany the application. If you have completed your studios or expect to do so before the period of your present stay expires and you plan to leavo the Unitod States, it is requested that this letter be dolivered to an officer of the Immigration and Naturalization Service at the port of doparture. Vory truly yours, Irvin F. Shrodo gate fills Officer in Chargo By: J. D. Perfetto Assistant Officer in Chargo P. S. If you intend to make application for an extension of stay, you must also submit a letter from the school you are attending which certifies that you are enrolled there for a full caurse of study or that you will be accepted there for the fall term of 1951. RFS 9-7-5
